question: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with an annual income of $75,000 and a credit score of 700?
true_answer: Yes, with credit score 700 and DTI 25%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment typically 3-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with an annual income of $75,000 and a credit score of 700?
Plan: 1) Consult home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 2) Verify credit score with credit_agent. 3) Calculate DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Affordability depends on credit score above 620 and DTI below 43%.
Credit score 700 is well above the minimum threshold.
Calculated DTI as 25%, which is below the 43% threshold.
What will be the monthly payment for this mortgage?
Using calculator to estimate monthly payment for $300,000 mortgage.
Estimated monthly payment is approximately $1,400 with current rates.
Retrieving knowledge on down payment requirements.
Down payment is typically 3-20% depending on loan terms.
Review complete. Financial criteria and calculations verified.
Yes, with credit score 700 and DTI 25%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment typically 3-20%.
